intro: Corydalis lineariloba var. fumariifolia, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae, characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers and delicate foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or shaded environments, showcasing its adaptability to challenging conditions. Its linear, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers make it a striking addition to botanical gardens. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological significance.
